pullrequest.title: [Suggestion] Return positive infinity instead of -1 for boundless positive values

content.raw:
Do you mean updating the SDF XML specification?

The changes in this PR only affect the output of SDF’s DOM API. I didn’t want to alter the XML specification, because that could be harmful to backwards compatibility.

I believe it's already possible for users to pass "inf" into an SDF file, and it will get lexicographically parsed to a floating point infinity, but I don't know if that's something we officially support, or if it's just a happy coincidence from using `std::stod`.

If we want to officially support users putting “\+/-inf” into their SDF documents and add it to the specification, then I could write some tests to make sure we’re parsing “inf” correctly and then add it to the documentation.
content.html:
Do you mean updating the SDF XML specification?

The changes in this PR only affect the output of SDF’s DOM API. I didn’t want to alter the XML specification, because that could be harmful to backwards compatibility.

I believe it's already possible for users to pass "inf" into an SDF file, and it will get lexicographically parsed to a floating point infinity, but I don't know if that's something we officially support, or if it's just a happy coincidence from using std::stod.

If we want to officially support users putting “+/-inf” into their SDF documents and add it to the specification, then I could write some tests to make sure we’re parsing “inf” correctly and then add it to the documentation.
